name: gold mine operation with extraction | gold-silver, ingot | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/20992/documentation

This dataset describes the production of gold-silver dore in Peru. ;The mining operations are located in Ancash (Peru). The data set includes the mining, beneficiation, and smelting process to obtain gold-silver dore containing gold, silver and impurities. ;The data were collected from the available information reported on the Environmental Impact Studies and available information from a representative gold mine in Peru. The emissions were analyzed based on the Environmental.monitoring reports of the mining company.;The system includes energy, reagents  water consumption, and air and water emissions.;The metallurgical process treats mineralized material through a conventional two-stage crushing plant, followed by a heap leaching process, minerals of greater granulometry are directly sent to the leach pad system. The solution from the leach pad system is captured in the column carbon process plant (CIC) to concentrate part of the rich solution, and then recover the gold and silver metals through the Merrill Crowe process of precipitation with zinc dust.;The industrial process mainly comprises the following stages:;- Handling the ore to the crushing area.;- Primary and secondary crushing.;- Transport and unloading of crushed ore to the heap leaching system.;- Leaching in piles applying irrigation of diluted solution of sodium cyanide.;- CIC Plant;- Precipitation with zinc dust.;- Filtration of the precipitate.;- Smelting;The activity ends when the gold-silver ingots (dore) are ready to be transported to their final destination.;;[This dataset is meant to replace the following datasets:; - gold-silver mine operation with refinery, PE, 2004 - 2006 (9e634234-9fae-4013-82f5-cf7d62245772)]

The modeled system starts with the explotation of the mineral ore.

This dataset includes the mining, beneficiation and smelting process to obtain gold-silver dore. The system includes energy, reagents  water consumption, and air and water emissions. Industrial water is treated before is discharged to the environment. Note that the water emissions are limited on what is reported on site.
category: C:Manufacturing/24:Manufacture of basic metals/242:Manufacture of basic precious and other non-ferrous metals/2420:Manufacture of basic precious and other non-ferrous metals

processDocumentation.timeDescription: The data was collected from the Environmental Impact Studies (2011-2014), monitoring reports (2015-2016) and other technical information (2010-2016). Therefore the time period is set on 2010-2016.
processDocumentation.geographyDescription: Inputs and outputs for mining, beneficiation and smelting are from a peruvian mining company located in Huaraz province. Mining and smelting activitites take place in only one location.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Modeled mine is an open pit (100%), gold recovery is done through a leaching process. ;The solution from the leach pad system is captured in the column carbon process plant (CIC) to concentrate part of the rich solution, and then recover the gold and silver metals through the Merrill Crowe process of precipitation with zinc dust.;The industrial process mainly comprises the following stages:;- Handling the ore to the crushing area.;- Primary and secondary crushing.;- Transport and unloading of crushed ore to the heap leaching system.;- Leaching in piles applying irrigation of diluted solution of sodium cyanide.;- CIC Plant;- Precipitation with zinc dust.;- Filtration of the precipitate.;- Smelting;.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: The data were collected  from a gold company with open pit method that represent the 9.23% of the gold production in Peru (Peruvian Ministry of Mine production stadistics, 2016).

exchanges.description: Calculated value based on the gold anual production  reported by the Ministry of Energy and Mines (2016),
